def_cn: (对身体)无害的，安全的
def_en: Something that is safe does not cause physical harm or danger.

def_cn: 不会受伤的;不会受损的
def_en: If a person or thing is safe from something, they cannot be harmed or damaged by it.

def_cn: 安全的;没有受伤的;安然无恙的
def_en: If you are safe, you have not been harmed, or you are not in danger of being harmed.

def_cn: (地方)安全的，可靠的，保险的
def_en: A safe place is one where it is unlikely that any harm, damage, or unpleasant things will happen to the people or things that are there.

def_cn: (旅途)平安的，无损的，一路顺风的
def_en: If people or things have a safe journey, they reach their destination without harm, damage, or unpleasant things happening to them.

def_cn: (距离)安全的，不会遭到伤害的
def_en: If you are at a safe distance from something or someone, you are far enough away from them to avoid any danger, harm, or unpleasant effects.

def_cn: 不会丢失的;志在必得的;稳操胜券的
def_en: If something you have or expect to obtain is safe, you cannot lose it or be prevented from having it.

def_cn: (行动)风险小的，万无一失的，保险的
def_en: A safe course of action is one in which there is very little risk of loss or failure.

def_cn: 四平八稳的;缺乏新意的;不够刺激的
def_en: If you disapprove of something because you think it is not very exciting or original, you can describe it as safe .

def_cn: 有把握的;不会有错的;可以肯定的
def_en: If it is safe to say or assume something, you can say it with very little risk of being wrong.

def_cn: (秘密)不会被泄漏的，会被保守的，安全的
def_en: If you say to someone that their secret is safe with you, you are promising not to tell it to anyone.

def_cn: 保险柜
def_en: A safe is a strong metal cupboard with special locks, in which you keep money, jewellery, or other valuable things.
safely;

def_cn: 得到妥善照顾的;由可靠的人保护(或保管)的
def_en: If you say that a person or thing is in safe hands, or is safe in someone's hands, you mean that they are being looked after by a reliable person and will not be harmed.

def_cn: 非常安全的;绝对安全的
def_en: If you say that something or someone is as safe as houses, you mean that they are completely safe.

def_cn: 使(某地)适合开展(某活动);使适宜
def_en: If someone tries to make a place safe for a particular activity, they try to make the place suitable for that activity, although their efforts may have very undesirable effects.

def_cn: 谨慎行事;避免冒险
def_en: If you play safe or play it safe, you do not take any risks.

def_cn: 谨慎为是;以防万一;为安全起见
def_en: If you say you are doing something to be on the safe side, you mean that you are doing it in case something undesirable happens, even though this may be unnecessary.

def_cn: 宁可事先谨慎有余，不要事后追悔莫及
def_en: If you say 'it's better to be safe than sorry', you are advising someone to take action in order to avoid possible unpleasant consequences later, even if this seems unnecessary.

def_cn: 平平安安的;安然无恙的
def_en: You say that someone is safe and sound when they are still alive or unharmed after being in danger.
a safe pair of hands→see: pair;  safe in the knowledge→see: knowledge;
